intro: Calothamnus phellosus, commonly known as the golden everlasting or the red bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange bottlebrush-like flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is commonly used in gardens for its ornamental value. Calothamnus phellosus is also known for its ability to attract native pollinators such as bees and birds.
